translations.name: Luther Bible
translations.description: The Luther Bible is a German language Bible translated from the Hebrew and ancient Greek by Martin Luther while he was hiding in Wartburg Castle. The New Testament was first published in 1522. The complete Bible, containing both the Old and New Testaments as well as the Apocrypha was published and distributed throughout Germany 12 years later in 1534. In order to separate this translation from the Catholic versions that preceded it, Luther translated it from the original Greek and Hebrew.

translations.name: Biblia / das ist / die gantze Heilige Schrifft Deudsch
